## Lists

### Bulleted list
* Item 1
	* Nested bulleds need a 4-space indent.
	* Item 1b
*	It's possible to put multiple paragraphs of text in a list item,
	But to do that, the second and subsequent paragraphs must be
	indented by four or more spaces. It looks better if the first
	bullet is also indented.

### Numbered list
1. Items are numbered automatically, even though they all start with 1.
1. Item 2.
	* Item a
	* Item b

## Graphics

### Plotting using base R
```{r}
	graphics::hist(stats::rnorm(1000))
```

### Plotting using ggplot2
```{r}
	lty <- c("11", "18", "1f", "81", "88", "8f", "f1", "f8", "ff")
	linetypes <- base::data.frame(y = base::seq_along(lty), lty = lty) 
	ggplot2::ggplot(linetypes, ggplot2::aes(0, y)) + 
	ggplot2::geom_segment(ggplot2::aes(xend = 5, yend = y, linetype = lty)) + 
	ggplot2::scale_linetype_identity() + 
	ggplot2::geom_text(ggplot2::aes(label = lty), hjust = 0, nudge_y = 0.2) +
	ggplot2::scale_x_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL) + 
	ggplot2::scale_y_reverse(NULL, breaks = NULL)
```

### Displaying file using base RMD
![](np-propensity-scatter-01.png)

### Displaying file using png and knitr
```{r, echo = FALSE, out.width = "70%", out.height = "70%"}
	img1_path <- "np-propensity-scatter-03.png"
	img1 <- png::readPNG(img1_path, native = TRUE, info = TRUE)
	base::attr(img1, "info")
	knitr::include_graphics(img1_path)
```
